CCheckboxControl

A checkbox/radio control.

This control extends CControl.  All basic properties and functions are implemented and documented in this class.

Summary
CCheckboxControlA checkbox/radio control.
Properties
CheckedIf true, the control is checked.
Functions
AddControlAdds a control to this control that will be visible/enabled only when this checkbox/radio button is checked.
GetRadioButtonGroupReturns the group of radio buttons this radio button belongs to as an array of controls.
GetSelectedRadioButtonReturns the radio button control of the current group which is currently selected.
Events
Introduction1) Use an event handler.
CheckedChanged()Invoked when the checkbox/radio value changes.

Properties

Checked

If true, the control is checked.

Functions

AddControl

Adds a control to this control that will be visible/enabled only when this checkbox/radio button is checked.  The parameters correspond to the Add() function of CGUI.

Parameters

TypeThe type of the control.
NameThe name of the control.
OptionsOptions used for creating the control.
TextThe text of the control.
UseEnabledStateIf true, the control will be enabled/disabled instead of visible/hidden.

GetRadioButtonGroup

Returns the group of radio buttons this radio button belongs to as an array of controls.

GetSelectedRadioButton

Returns the radio button control of the current group which is currently selected.  Returns 0 if no button is selected.

Events

Introduction

There are currently 3 methods to handle control events

1) Use an event handler.  Simply use control.EventName.Handler := “HandlingFunction” Instead of “HandlingFunction” it is also possible to pass a function reference or a Delegate: control.EventName.Handler := new Delegate(Object, “HandlingFunction”) If this method is used, the first parameter will contain the control object that sent this event.

2) Create a function with this naming scheme in your window class: ControlName_EventName(params)

3) Instead of using ControlName_EventName() you may also call CControl.RegisterEvent on a control instance to register a different event function name.  This method is deprecated since event handlers are more flexible.

The parameters depend on the event and there may not be params at all in some cases.

CheckedChanged()

Invoked when the checkbox/radio value changes.

Basic control class from which all controls extend.
Attention!
